author: TNN
title: South Public School Celebrates Annual Day 'Desh Ki Dhun' with Cultural Extravaganza | Nagpur News - Times of India
text: Nagpur: The South Public School celebrated its annual day ‘Desh Ki Dhun', with grandeur and cultural vibrancies at the Suresh Bhat Auditorium, Reshimbagh, on Dec 2. The event witnessed an inspiring address by police commissioner Ravinder Singal, who encouraged students to adopt the role of ‘young police officers' to reduce societal crimes and accidents. \"Children, become ‘police mitra' (police friends) and contribute to building a safer society,\" he urged.Chief guest Col Manish Kinhikar (retd), commended the school for its dedication to holistic education.School pincipal Mrunalini Dasture presented a detailed account of the school's achievements of the year, while chairman Deaven Dasture delivered the opening remarks.A highlight of the event was the screening of a video showcasing inspirational messages from the school's alumni, who have excelled in various fields and sectors, including ISRO, NASA, medicine, beauty pageants, accounting, environmental initiatives, and industry leadership.With the backdrop of India hosting the G20 Summit, the programme creatively integrated themes showcasing Indian culture to foreign dignitaries. The event began with a mesmerising performance based on Raag Jay Jaywanti. Students from Std VI to X enthralled the audience with captivating presentations of Bharatanatyam, Kathak, tribal dances, Kantara, Powadas, and other diverse art forms.Chairman Deaven Dasture, principal Mrunalini Dasture, vice-principal Mangesh Chinewar, along with coordinators Manisha Salunke, Jayashree Deshmukh, Meenal Tandaiya, commended the tireless efforts of all teachers and students for the programme's success. The vibrant celebration was not just an annual event but a reflection of the school's commitment to academic excellence and cultural enrichment.
